properties.name: authentication
properties.description: OAuth Authorization Flow

options.name: Account
options.description: Represents an individual account, which is an organization or person involved with your business (such as customers, competitors, and partners)

options.name: Attachment
options.description: Represents a file that a has uploaded and attached to a parent object

options.name: Case
options.description: Represents a case, which is a customer issue or problem

options.name: Contact
options.description: Represents a contact, which is an individual associated with an account

options.name: Custom Object
options.description: Represents a custom object

options.name: Document
options.description: Represents a document

options.name: Flow
options.description: Represents an autolaunched flow

options.name: Lead
options.description: Represents a prospect or potential

options.name: Opportunity
options.description: Represents an opportunity, which is a sale or pending deal

options.name: Search
options.description: Search records

options.name: Task
options.description: Represents a business activity such as making a phone call or other to-do items. In the user interface, and records are collectively referred to as activities.

options.name: User
options.description: Represents a person, which is one user in system

options.name: Add Lead To Campaign
options.description: Add lead to a campaign
options.action: Add a lead to a campaign

options.name: Add Note
options.description: Add note to a lead
options.action: Add a note to a lead

options.name: Create
options.description: Create a lead

options.name: Create or Update
options.description: Create a new lead, or update the current one if it already exists (upsert)

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete a lead

options.name: Get
options.description: Get a lead

options.name: Get Many
options.description: Get many leads

options.name: Get Summary
options.description: Returns an overview of Lead's metadata

options.name: Update
options.description: Update a lead

properties.name: externalId
properties.description: The field to check to see if the lead already exists. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties.name: externalIdValue
properties.description: If this value exists in the 'match against' field, update the lead. Otherwise create a new one.

properties.name: company
properties.description: Company of the lead. If person account record types have been enabled, and if the value of Company is null, the lead converts to a person account.

properties.name: lastname
properties.description: Required. Last name of the lead. Limited to 80 characters.

options.name: annualRevenue
options.description: Annual revenue for the company of the lead

options.name: city
options.description: City for the address of the lead

options.name: country
options.description: Country of the lead

options.name: customFieldsUi
options.description: Filter by custom fields

values.name: fieldId
values.description: The ID of the field to add custom field to. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: value
values.description: The value to set on custom field

options.name: description
options.description: Description of the lead

options.name: email
options.description: Email address for the lead

options.name: fax
options.description: Fax number of the lead

options.name: firstname
options.description: First name of the lead. Limited to 40 characters.

options.name: hasOptedOutOfEmail
options.description: Whether the lead doesn’t want to receive email from Salesforce (true) or does (false). Label is Email Opt Out.

options.name: hasOptedOutOfFax
options.description: Whether the lead doesn’t want to receive fax from Salesforce (true) or does (false). Label is Email Opt Out.

options.name: industry
options.description: Website for the lead

options.name: IsUnreadByOwner
options.description: Whether true, lead has been assigned, but not yet viewed. See Unread Leads for more information. Label is Unread By Owner.

options.name: jigsaw
options.description: References the ID of a contact in Data.com. If a lead has a value in this field, it means that a contact was imported as a lead from Data.com.

options.name: leadSource
options.description: Source from which the lead was obtained. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: mobilePhone
options.description: Contact’s mobile phone number

options.name: numberOfEmployees
options.description: Number of employees at the lead’s company. Label is Employees.

options.name: owner
options.description: The owner of the lead. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: phone
options.description: Phone number for the lead

options.name: postalCode
options.description: Postal code for the address of the lead. Label is Zip/Postal Code.

options.name: recordTypeId
options.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

options.name: rating
options.description: Rating of the lead

options.name: salutation
options.description: Salutation for the lead

options.name: state
options.description: State for the address of the lead

options.name: status
options.description: Status code for this converted lead. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: street
options.description: Street number and name for the address of the lead

options.name: title
options.description: Title for the lead, for example CFO or CEO

options.name: website
options.description: Website for the lead

properties.name: externalId

properties.name: externalIdValue
properties.description: If this value exists in the 'match against' field, update the opportunity. Otherwise create a new one.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Required. Last name of the opportunity. Limited to 80 characters.

properties.name: closeDate
properties.description: Required. Date when the opportunity is expected to close.

properties.name: stageName
properties.description: Required. Date when the opportunity is expected to close. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.description: ID of the account associated with this opportunity. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.description: Estimated total sale amount

options.description: It is implied, but not directly controlled, by the StageName field

options.description: Source from which the lead was obtained. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: nextStep
options.description: Description of next task in closing opportunity. Limit: 255 characters.

options.description: Phone number for the opportunity

options.description: ID of a related Pricebook2 object

options.name: probability
options.description: Percentage of estimated confidence in closing the opportunity

options.description: Type of opportunity. For example, Existing Business or New Business. Label is Opportunity Type.

options.name: description
options.description: A text description of the case. Limit: 32 KB.

options.name: isEscalated
options.description: Whether indicates whether the case has been escalated (true) or not

options.name: origin
options.description: The source of the case, such as Email, Phone, or Web. Label is Case Origin. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: owner
options.description: The owner of the case. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: ParentId
options.description: The ID of the parent case in the hierarchy. The label is Parent Case.

options.name: priority
options.description: The importance or urgency of the case, such as High, Medium, or Low. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: reason
options.description: The reason why the case was created, such as Instructions not clear, or User didn’t attend training. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: recordTypeId
options.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

options.name: status
options.description: The status of the case, such as “New,” “Closed,” or “Escalated.” This field directly controls the IsClosed flag. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: subject
options.description: The subject of the case. Limit: 255 characters.

options.name: suppliedCompany
options.description: The company name that was entered when the case was created. This field can't be updated after the case has been created..

options.name: suppliedEmail
options.description: The email address that was entered when the case was created. This field can't be updated after the case has been created.

options.name: suppliedName
options.description: The name that was entered when the case was created. This field can't be updated after the case has been created.

options.name: suppliedPhone
options.description: The phone number that was entered when the case was created. This field can't be updated after the case has been created.

options.name: Create
options.description: Create a task

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete a task

options.name: Get
options.description: Get a task

options.name: Get Many
options.description: Get many tasks

options.name: Get Summary
options.description: Returns an overview of task's metadata

options.name: Update
options.description: Update a task

properties.name: status
properties.description: The current status of the task, such as In Progress or Completed. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: activityDate
options.description: Represents the due date of the task. This field has a timestamp that is always set to midnight in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone.

options.name: callDisposition
options.description: Represents the result of a given call, for example, “we'll call back,” or “call unsuccessful.” Limit is 255 characters. Not subject to field-level security, available for any user in an organization with Salesforce CRM Call Center.

options.name: callDurationInSeconds
options.description: Duration of the call in seconds. Not subject to field-level security, available for any user in an organization with Salesforce CRM Call Center.

options.name: callObject
options.description: Name of a call center. Limit is 255 characters. Not subject to field-level security, available for any user in an organization with Salesforce CRM Call Center.

options.name: callType
options.description: The type of call being answered: Inbound, Internal, or Outbound. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: customFieldsUi
options.description: Filter by custom fields

values.name: fieldId
values.description: The ID of the field to add custom field to. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

values.name: value
values.description: The value to set on custom field

options.name: description
options.description: Contains a text description of the task

options.name: isReminderSet
options.description: Whether a popup reminder has been set for the task (true) or not (false)

options.name: owner
options.description: ID of the User who owns the record. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: priority
options.description: Indicates the importance or urgency of a task, such as high or low. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: recurrenceType
options.description: Recurrence Type of the task. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: recurrenceInstance
options.description: The frequency of the recurring task. For example, “2nd” or “3rd.”. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: recurrenceInterval
options.description: The interval between recurring tasks

options.name: recurrenceDayOfMonth
options.description: The day of the month in which the task repeats

options.name: recurrenceDayOfWeekMask
options.description: The day or days of the week on which the task repeats. This field contains a bitmask. The values are as follows: Sunday = 1 Monday = 2 Tuesday = 4 Wednesday = 8 Thursday = 16 Friday = 32 Saturday = 64 Multiple days are represented as the sum of their numerical values. For example, Tuesday and Thursday = 4 + 16 = 20.

options.name: recurrenceEndDateOnly
options.description: The last date on which the task repeats. This field has a timestamp that is always set to midnight in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone.

options.name: recurrenceMonthOfYear
options.description: The month of the year in which the task repeats

options.name: recurrenceRegeneratedType
options.description: Represents what triggers a repeating task to repeat. Add this field to a page layout together with the RecurrenceInterval field, which determines the number of days between the triggering date (due date or close date) and the due date of the next repeating task in the series. Label is Repeat This Task.

options.name: recurrenceEndDateOnly
options.description: The date when the recurring task begins. Must be a date and time before RecurrenceEndDateOnly.

options.name: recurrenceTimeZoneSidKey
options.description: The time zone associated with the recurring task. For example, “UTC-8:00” for Pacific Standard Time.

options.name: reminderDateTime
options.description: Represents the time when the reminder is scheduled to fire, if IsReminderSet is set to true. If IsReminderSet is set to false, then the user may have deselected the reminder checkbox in the Salesforce user interface, or the reminder has already fired at the time indicated by the value.

options.name: subject
options.description: The subject line of the task, such as “Call” or “Send Quote.” Limit: 255 characters. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: type
options.description: Represents Type of the task, such as Call or Meeting. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: whatId
options.description: The WhatId represents nonhuman objects such as accounts, opportunities, campaigns, cases, or custom objects. WhatIds are polymorphic. Polymorphic means a WhatId is equivalent to the ID of a related object.

options.name: whoId
options.description: The WhoId represents a human such as a lead or a contact. WhoIds are polymorphic. Polymorphic means a WhoId is equivalent to a contact’s ID or a lead’s ID.
